name: TheAtlantic
text: In quarantine, @amandamull writes, clutter is, in a thousand unexpected ways, a savior. https://t.co/139rEe3btE

name: TheAtlantic
text: Listen to @alexismadrigal update @jameshamblin and @katlwells on the coronavirus numbers — and why the spread of the pandemic seems so random: https://t.co/P39Rn5QLGW

name: TheAtlantic
text: From open-air cafés to drive-in theaters at airports, how might the pandemic transform cities? @YasmeenSerhan considers the possibilities: https://t.co/7hM5XlJEoQ

name: TheAtlantic
text: Films like "Do the Right Thing" and "The Spook Who Sat by the Door" frame urban uprisings as just actions against brutality and as catalysts for change. @samshepPhD on movies about American protest: https://t.co/LMEZmfERsG

name: TheAtlantic
text: "Once the country has an improved idea about what policing is for, then begins the process of developing evidence-informed policies and practices to carry out that vision," @mearest and Tom R. Tyler write: https://t.co/rljgXcSqE0
